p: The SUS, regulated by Laws No. 8080/1990 and No. 8.142/1990, is one of the largest and most complex public health systems in the world, the ideological principles of which are universality, integrality, and equity for the entire population. It involves the three levels of the Federation: Union, States and Cities. The network composing the SUS encompasses primary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary care; urgent and emergency services, hospital care, and epidemiological, health and environmental surveillance actions, in addition to pharmaceutical care ( 5) .
